events.event_name: National Bank of Poland February Rate Decision
events.description: The National Bank of Poland kept its main interest rate unchanged at 4% in February.
A new inflation projection and final inflation figures for January and February will be published in March.

facts.fact_text: The National Bank of Poland kept its main interest rate unchanged at 4% in February.

evidences.evidence_text: The National Bank of Poland kept its main interest rate unchanged at 4% in February, as expected

facts.fact_text: The central bank's target range for inflation is 1.5% to 3.5%.

evidences.evidence_text: the central bank’s 1.5% to 3.5% target range

claims.claim_text: Some analysts expected a 25 basis point cut in February.
claims.author: analysts

evidences.evidence_text: views were split, with some analysts expecting a 25 basis point cut

claims.claim_text: Policymakers are waiting for new macroeconomic forecasts before considering further easing.
claims.author: policymakers

evidences.evidence_text: policymakers wait for new macroeconomic forecasts before considering further easing

claims.claim_text: The March projection will allow a clearer assessment of the disinflation trend's sustainability.

evidences.evidence_text: allowing a clearer assessment of whether the recent disinflation trend is sustainable

evidence.evidence_text: policymakers wait for new macroeconomic forecasts before considering further easing
A new inflation projection will be published in March, allowing a clearer assessment of whether the recent disinflation trend is sustainable.
final inflation figures for January and February will also be released in March following changes to the statistical basket
